Name: Fragment of painted relief
Description: Fragment of limestone relief, with part of a geometrical border of alternating longer and shorter rectangular segments separated by the framing lines: on this fragment, the framing is in black, the short segment white, and the longer a blue-green. On the preserved side beyond this border is part of a banded triangle of red, light blue and dark blue. This is part of the wall decoration in the temple to the cult of king Nebhepetra Mentuhotep, who reunited Egypt at the start of the Middle Kingdom c.2025 BC.
